plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer‚Äôs deep-seated frustration with default layer names like ‚ÄúRectangle 123‚Äù and ‚ÄúGroup 87.‚Äù Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene‚Äîand now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like ‚Äúsuch_lazy‚Äù or ‚Äúidentity_crisis.‚Äù Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. üéâ

accepted.description:
Professional & Punchy
Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.name: push-my-icons
plugins.description:
Push your Figma SVG icons to GitHub with ease.


This plugin helps you

  1. Automatically extract SVG nodes
  2. Upload them to your GitHub repository
  3. Generate a pull request with added/updated/removed icons


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin and fill in the following fields:
  2. GitHub personal access token
  3. GitHub repository URL
  4. Target folder path in the repo (e.g., src/icons)
  5. Pull request title and description
  6. Select all frames that contain your SVG icon components.
  7. Each selected frame should be a top-level container for one or more SVGs.
  8. Click "Push" button.
  9. The plugin will:
  10. Export all SVGs found in the selected frames
  11. Upload them to the specified folder in your GitHub repo
  12. Create a pull request containing added, updated, or deleted icon files
plugins.tagline: Push selected Figma icons to GitHub in one click.

plugins.name: Frames to Pages
plugins.description:
‚ú® About the Plugin


Organize your Figma files more efficiently!


This plugin moves each selected frame into its own new page automatically, helping you:


  1. Improve performance on heavy files.
  2. Make navigation faster and more intuitive.
  3. Keep versions and project sections clearly separated.


Perfect for large projects, collaborative teams, and anyone who values a clean and structured workspace.


üí° Why use this plugin?


As Figma projects grow, pages often become crowded with dozens (or hundreds) of frames.

This can cause:


  1. Slower loading times.
  2. Harder navigation and confusion for new collaborators.
  3. Increased risk of overwriting or losing important work.


By splitting frames into separate pages, your file becomes lighter, faster, and easier to maintain.


üìö Common Use Cases


  1. Large projects: Quickly organize dozens of screens into individual pages.


  1. Version management: Save different design versions separately without cluttering a single page.


  1. Developer handoff: Share organized sections with developers more easily.


  1. Team collaboration: Help new team members find what they need faster.


üõ†Ô∏è How it works


  1. Select the frames you want to organize.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Choose whether to delete the original page or keep it.


Each selected frame will be placed into a brand new page, keeping its content intact.
plugins.tagline: Move each selected frame into its own new page automatically. Organize your Figma files easily.

plugins.name: AI Brand Guide
plugins.description:
AI Brand Guide transforms your design files into comprehensive, professional brand guides in seconds. Extract and organize design elements from your Figma files to create beautiful, developer-friendly documentation.


Key Features

  1. Intelligent Design Element Categorization: Automatically organizes your elements into Buttons, Icons, and Other Elements based on naming patterns
  2. Multi-Frame Export: Choose between Single Frame (all sections in one scrollable frame) or Separate Frames (each section in its own dedicated frame)
  3. Color Palette Extraction: Automatically extracts colors from your selection with detailed RGB, HEX, and HSL values
  4. AI-Powered Color Naming: Generate professional, creative names for your color palette with a single click
  5. Color Theory Generation: Create comprehensive color theory documentation including palette overview, color roles, visual qualities, and usage recommendations
  6. Typography Hierarchy System: Extracts and organizes typography into a structured system with Header and Paragraph classifications
  7. Component Documentation: Displays detailed specifications for buttons, icons and other elements including exact dimensions and padding values
  8. Visual Previews: Generates thumbnail previews for all design elements
  9. Form Element Detection: Special handling for contact forms and other form elements with improved display


How It Works

  1. Select your design elements in Figma (frames, components, or entire pages)
  2. Generate your brand guide with a single click
  3. Customize your guide: Rename colors, add color theory, or organize elements
  4. Export to Figma: Choose your preferred layout style and generate a complete brand guide directly in your Figma file


Element Categorization

For best results, use these naming patterns:

  1. Buttons: Include "btn" or "button" in the name (e.g., "btn-primary", "submit-button")
  2. Icons: Include "icn" or "icon" in the name (e.g., "icn-home", "arrow-icon")
  3. Other Elements: Include "element" or "other" in the name (e.g., "card-element", "other-banner")


What's Included in Your Brand Guide

  1. Color Palette: Complete color documentation with visual swatches and color codes
  2. Typography System: Organized type hierarchy with font details and visual examples
  3. Buttons Collection: All button variants with exact dimensions and padding specifications
  4. Icon Library: Organized icon set with dimensions and specifications
  5. Additional Elements: Cards, banners, forms and other UI components with detailed measurements
  6. Color Theory: Optional section providing insights on palette psychology, symbolism and usage


AI Brand Guide helps design teams maintain consistency while giving developers the exact specifications they need to implement designs accurately.
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into comprehensive brand guides with AI-powered color intelligence.

plugins.name: Component repeater
plugins.description:
# Component Repeater


A Figma plugin that helps you create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images.


## What it does


This plugin analyzes your selection and creates a component that intelligently handles:


- Style variations (colors, effects, layout properties)

- Text content variations

- Image variations


When you have multiple similar elements that differ in styles or content, this plugin will:


1. Create a main component with variants for different styles

2. Create a separate component set for image variations

3. Replace all selected elements with instances of the component

4. Preserve the original text content and image placement


## How to use it


1. **Select similar elements**


- Select two or more groups or frames that have the same structure

- The plugin has a feature to help you find all similar elements from one selected node

- The elements can have different styles, text content, or images but should have the same layer structure


2. **Run the plugin**


- The plugin will analyze your selection and show variations in:

- Text content

- Colors and effects

- Images

- Layout properties


3. **Create the component**


- Click "Replace selection with a component"

- The plugin will create:

- A main component with style variants (if variations exist)

- A separate image component set (if images are used)

- Instances that preserve the original variations


4. **Finding similar elements**

- Select a single element

- Click "Find Similar Nodes" to select all elements with the same structure

- Use this to find more elements to include for replacement


## Tips


- The plugin works best with elements that have the same structure (same hierarchy of layers)

- Style variations are automatically detected and turned into variants

- Text content is preserved in each instance

- Images are turned into a swappable component

- Use the resize handle in the bottom right to adjust the plugin window size


## Requirements


- Works with groups and frames

- Selected elements must have the same layer structure

- Supports both direct images and image fills
plugins.tagline: Create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images

plugins.name: The Ultimate Table
plugins.description:
The Ultimate Table is a powerful Figma plugin that enables you to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.


Features

  1. Rearrange, remove, add, or duplicate columns and rows
  2. Drag to adjust column widths in header cells
  3. Automatic row height adjustment based on content
  4. Maintain linked tables across your design


Styling Options

  1. Customizable padding, margins, and borders
  2. Column text alignment controls
  3. Zebra striping support
  4. Header styling with sort/filter/search indicators
  5. Custom border radius
  6. Flexible font and size options


Smart Updates

  1. Master table controls for consistent styling


Need a quick start?

  1. Learn all there is to know in less than 10 minutes in this video tutorial
  2. Complete tutorial (Written & Video) at ultimate-table.com
plugins.tagline: Finally a plugin to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.

plugins.name: Components to Section
plugins.description:
Easily regroup all your master components into a section. Runs across all pages of your file

Plugin does not have UI to run.


How to use

Launch via cmd + / or go to plugin > Component to Section

Tab and choose

  1. Run on current page
  2. Run on all pages
  3. Set preferences


Preferences (User saved)

  1. Choose where to create the section (current page or new page)
  2. Choose the spacing between regrouped components


Why paid?

I'm a hobbyist and it's very difficult to write clean efficient code.

I have a day job and it's a good way to keep me motivated and work extra hours.

$2 is the cheapest a plugin can be sold on figma, I was happy with $0.99 but hey...


If this plugin starts selling regularly I will keep adding commands to make it even more powerful


Free stuff

If you are looking for free stuff, I have published two widget and they are currently used by more than 50K users


Help out ?

I'm in the London, UK and always keen to hear about fellow hackers, If you want to contribute to the plugin or have a suggestion feel free to contact me on edwardbattistini.com/contact

plugins.description:
Introduction

Path Text Aligner is a Figma plugin that allows users to easily align text along any custom path, providing more flexibility and control over text placement in your design.


Function Description

  1. Aligns selected text to any vector path or shape.
  2. Adjusts text along curves, straight lines, and complex paths.
  3. Offers controls for offset and spacing to fine-tune text positioning.
  4. Supports multi-line text alignment along a path.


How to Use

  1. Select the text you want to align.
  2. Draw or select the path you want the text to follow.
  3. Run the plugin, and the text will automatically align to the path.
  4. Adjust settings for text spacing, direction, and offset to achieve the desired effect.


Notes

  1. This plugin works best with vector paths (e.g., lines or shapes).
  2. Ensure the text layer is not grouped with other objects for proper alignment.
  3. You may need to adjust font size or path curvature for optimal results.

plugins.name: ÁîªÊùøËá™Âä®ÁºñÂè∑ Auto Artboard Numbering
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin automates the numbering of selected Figma artboards, allowing you to customize the naming sequence with prefixes and suffixes. It supports multiple languages, enhancing your workflow efficiency and organization.


Function Introduction

  1. Automatically numbers selected artboards in Figma.
  2. Customizable naming with prefixes and suffixes.
  3. Supports multiple languages.
  4. Two naming sequences: left-to-right then top-to-bottom, or top-to-bottom then left-to-right.


How to Use

  1. Select the artboards you want to rename.
  2. Choose your preferred naming sequence.
  3. Optionally, add a prefix or suffix.
  4. Click "Apply Naming" to rename the selected artboards.


Notes

  1. Ensure artboards are selected before applying the naming operation.
  2. The plugin temporarily disables the apply button for 2 seconds to prevent accidental multiple clicks.

plugins.name: Icon Set Generator
plugins.description:
Turn a single icon into organized variable sizes, colors, and styles in a few clicks!


Streamline your arduous icon workflow in Figma. All you need to start is an icon in a frame, or in a component.


Icon Set Generator then helps you quickly create organized icon systems by duplicating and resizing frames, components, or variant sets into multiple sizes with custom stroke weights and an optional dark mode.


‚úÖ Auto-generates variant size sets with consistent naming

‚úÖ Lets you add dark mode (white) icon variants in a click

plugins.name: UXtweak: Prototype Usability Testing
plugins.description:
With the UXtweak Prototype Usability Testing Plugin, you can easily turn your designs and prototypes into powerful user testing studies‚Äîright from Figma. 


Making it simple to gather invaluable user feedback for identifying and resolving issues before they impact development. 


The plugin ensures quick, reliable, and optimized import of even your largest and most complex Figma files, preserving all interactions and animations, while offering the flexibility to test specific flows or entire prototypes.


How it works:

  1. Open your Figma file.
  2. Click Share and copy the file link (set to ‚ÄúAnyone with the link can view‚Äù).
  3. Go to UXtweak and create a Prototype Testing study.
  4. In the Designs tab, paste your Figma file link.
  5. Copy the generated plugin link.
  6. Open the UXtweak Figma plugin and paste it in.
  7. Choose the flows you want to import and click Import.


Your prototype will be ready to test in UXtweak‚Äîno exports, no uploads, just seamless usability testing.


Key features:‚Ä®


The plugin offers features to cover every aspect of your prototype usability testing needs.

  1. Seamless Figma integration: Quick import of your Figma prototypes, preserving designs and transitions.  
  2. Flexible study setup: Define custom tasks, add follow-up questions (survey) with skip logic (branching), and randomize task order.  
  3. Qualitative feedback: Capture screen, voice, and even face recordings to understand both what users do and why. Export videos in MP4 format for easy sharing.  
  4. Diverse recruitment options: Utilize our User Panel to recruit targeted participants for your studies, leverage your own database of users, or share a simple link.  
  5. Advanced analytics:

- Clickmaps & Heatmaps: Analyze clicks and identify hot spots to understand user attention.  

- Path analysis: Track exact user journeys, revealing where users get lost or deviate from

expected flows.  

- Funnel view: Gain a detailed understanding of participant drop-off points.  

- Session replay: Replay full user sessions to observe behavior in context.  


Start for free at https://www.uxtweak.com/ or learn more about the plugin in our Knowledge Hub.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs and prototypes into powerful user testing studies on UXtweak‚Äîright from Figma.

plugins.name: Orshot
plugins.description:
Orshot lets you generate dynamic images from templates using API and Integrations like Zapier, Airtable etc.


With Orshot's Figma Plugin, you can import your existing Figma designs in Orshot Studio as a template. And then you can auto-generate dynamic images from that template using Rest API, SDKs and Integrations


How to use the plugin(watch demo):

  1. Select a frame or a group in Figma which you want to import in Orshot Studio
  2. While selected, run the Orshot plugin from Plugins > Orshot
  3. You'll see a window showing the JSON for the selected design
  4. Copy the JSON and paste it in Orshot Studio > Import
  5. The selected design will be replicated in Orshot Studio
  6. After saving, you can automate the template in "API & Integrations" page for the template


Learn more on Figma design automation using Rest API


Notes:

  1. Only supported layers and styles are imported
  2. Current set of supported layers: Text, Rectangle, Circle, Arrows, Images
  3. Images are imported as placeholders which you can replace in Orshot Studio


If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to send an email at hi@orshot.com
plugins.tagline: Auto-Generate Images from your Figma Designs via API and Integrations

plugins.name: Quick Edit
plugins.description:
Quick Edit: Your Floating Toolkit for Figma Productivity


Quick Edit is a lightweight Figma plugin designed to supercharge your design workflow. It adds a convenient floating toolbar to your canvas, providing instant access to essential actions like Copy, Paste, Cut, Delete, and Clone. Streamline repetitive tasks with one-click precision, enhancing your focus without interruption.


Enjoy smart positioning that places pasted and cloned items intelligently relative to your selection or at the viewport's center. With a persistent copied state across operations and a minimal, responsive UI, Quick Edit ensures your most common design actions are always just a click away.

TypoFix is a powerful yet simple Figma plugin that scans your selected text layers and instantly detects inconsistencies in:

Click ‚ÄúScan Fonts‚Äù ‚Äì TypoFix uses your first selected text as a reference.

Export a CSV report for review, sharing, or documentation.

No setup, no learning curve ‚Äì just plug and scan.

plugins.name: Variantor
plugins.description:
Variantor is a powerful tool that allows you to quickly and easily generate multiple icon sizes from a single source. It automates the process of scaling and adjusting the outline for each size, saving time and simplifying work on UI kits and design systems.


What can Variantor do?

  1. Custom sizes and outline thickness

You can set your own size and outline thickness for each icon version, and Variantor will generate all the options in seconds, freeing you from tedious manual work.

  1. Quick color change

Variantor provides the ability to change fill and stroke colors for all icons at once, which is useful when creating branded color palettes.

  1. Flexible component settings

Adjust the margins and spacing of your component to improve its visual appearance. This will make it look more balanced and attractive.

  1. Simple and intuitive interface

Add, edit, or delete properties in just a couple of clicks. This plugin is useful for both novice designers and professionals working with extensive icon libraries.


Variantor is open source and available on GitHub.
plugins.tagline: Plugin for creating multiple icon sizes from a single icon

plugins.name: Fybril
plugins.description:
Fybril is a design-to-analytics tool made for product teams. It helps you define what to measure in your design and product decisions‚Äîand see how those decisions perform through connected analytics. Fybril stands out by combining design understanding with analytics planning in one easy workflow.


Whether you're a product designer or a product manager, Fybril helps you track what matters, streamline communication with developers, and stay aligned with your goals.


With Fybril you can:

  1. Figma Plugin ‚Äî Import your designs directly from Figma to start connecting design with events to track.
  2. Home View ‚Äî Define the problem you're solving, outline product or business goals, and describe the solution you want to track and analyze.
  3. Flow View ‚Äî Build a user flow using screens and text blocks. Set the first screen as the entry point to start preparing the event tracking plan.
  4. Events View‚ÄîManage all events and event properties linked to your screens. This creates a clear, visual tracking plan to guide developers on what to implement.
  5. Analytics View‚ÄîSee insights for your flow or sub-flows. (Currently support only Mixpanel)
  6. Share & Collaborate‚ÄîInvite teammates to your workspace and share your tracking plan or complete documents (Home, Flow, Events, Analytics) for seamless collaboration.


Getting started video | WebsiteÔªø

plugins.name: Variable Copy Paste & Export
plugins.description:
Simple plugin that copies and pastes variables between files. Copied variables can also be exported into CSV format.


HOW TO USE:

  1. Open the plugin and hit "Copy Variables". The copied collections and modes should then appear in the plugin UI.
  2. Go to the file you want to paste to, open the plugin and hit "Paste".
  3. Double-check that the pasted variables match the original. Sometimes they get pasted out of order.
  4. Copied variables can also be exported by hitting "Export" and then clicking on the "Download CSV" link that appears underneath.


PLEASE NOTE: Aliases that reference external (non-local) variables will not work and will be shown in the console if found. Also, pasted variables may not always end up in their original order- I am not a dev and don't know why this happens (if anyone can help, please reach out!!!)

138387.name: Export-Dims
138387.description:
With either a single mock or multiple mocks, this plugin lets you grab dimensions, scaled or raw, for mock elements. If the mock elements don't exist, custom regions can be created and defined.


Much of the calculations are based on what's needed to incorporate mocks into a Qualtrics workflow, particularly one that uses sticky headers. For more on that implementation and how to use the data from this plugin in your pipeline please reach out to terrencepope@.
138387.release_notes: Cleaned up the code to be more readable
138387.tagline: Quickly grab dimensions for Figma frames and nodes.
